content.question_text: If a ∶ b ∶ c ∶ d = √4 ∶ √3 ∶ √2 ∶ √1, then what is the value of ‌‌(−a2‌+‌b2‌+‌c2‌+‌d2)‌‌(a2−b2+c2−d2) ?
The speeds of four cars are 2u, 3u, 4u and xu and the time taken by them to cover the same distance is xt, 4t, 3t and 2t respectively, where x, u, t are real numbers. What is the value of x?
If m ∶ n = 1 ∶ 2 and p ∶ q = 3 ∶ 4, then what is (2m + 4p) ∶ (n + 3q) equal to ?
If the rate of interest is 5%, then what would be the difference between compound interest and simple interest received on ₹ 10,000 (each) after 3 years from now?
A person bought a book at 3/4th of its listed price and sold it at 50% more than its listed price. What is the percentage of gain in the transaction?
If the difference between the interior and exterior angles of a regular polygon is 144°, then what is the number of sides of the polygon ?
If the sum and product of the roots of a quadratic equation are 2 and - 100 respectively, then which one of the following is correct?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : There is only one such equation which is x2 - 2x - 100 = 0.

content.question_text: If 2 is a zero of the polynomial p(x) = x3 + 3x2 - 6x - a, then what is the sum of the squares of the other zeros of the polynomial?
If t = cos 79°, then what is cosec 79° (1 - cos 79°) equal to ?

Suppose p(x) = x4 + a3x3 + a2x2 + a1x + a0 and q(x) = x4 + b3x3 + b2x2 + b1x +b0 polynomials. If α, β, γ , δ are zeros of p(x) and α, β, γ, λ are zeros of q(x), then what is ‌p(x)−q(x)(x−α‌)(x−β)(x−γ‌) equal to ?
If the equation x cos θ = x2 + p has a real solution for every θ where 0 ≤ θ ≤ ‌π‌4, then which one of the following is correct?
What is the difference between the greatest value and the least value of cos2θ + 3 sin2 θ + 2 ?
ABC is a right-angled triangle, right-angled at B such that AB = 6 cm and BC = 8 cm. What is the perimeter of the square inscribed in the triangle ABC with maximum area?
What is the greatest value of k for which 2x2 - 4x + k = 0 has real roots?

Consider the following data:110, 41, 43, 95, 127, 99, 61, 92, 71, 93, 110, 36. If 93 is replaced by 94, then consider the following statements:1. The difference between new median and old median is 1.2. The difference between new mean and old mean is less than 0.1.3. The difference between new mode and old mode is zero.Which of the statements given above are correct?
What is the digit at the 100th place of number (225)40 ?
If a, b, c, d are natural numbers, then how many possible remainders are there when 1a + 2b + 3c + 4d is divided by 10?
If n is a natural number, then what is the sum of all distinct remainders of 4n + 6n + 9n + 11n when divided by 10 for various values of n?
When the number(12345678910111213 ... 99100) is divided by 16, what will be the remainder?

A, B, C, D can complete a work in 3, 6, 9, 12 hours respectively. Further, only one person can work at a time in each hour and nobody can work for two consecutive hours. It is not necessary to engage all. What is the minimum number of hours that they will take to finish the work?
If p = ‌3√(a+√a2+b3)+‌3√(a−√a2+b3), then what is p3 + 3bp equal to ?
A plank of wood 4.25 m long and 3.4 m wide is to be cut into square pieces of equal size. How many square pieces of largest size can be cut from the plank, if no wastage is allowed?
What is the HCF of x4 - 13x2y2 - 300y4, x3 - 4x2y - 4xy2 - 5y3 and x3 - 125y3 ?
If HCF of 768 and x6y2 is 32xy for natural numbers x ≥ 2, y ≥ 2, then what is the value of (x + y)?
What is the smallest natural number n such that (n + 1) × n × (n - 1) × (n - 2) × ... 3 × 2 × 1 is divisible by 910?
The expression 555777 + 777555 is divisible by which of the following?1. 22. 33. 37Select the correct answer using the code given below:

Consider the following statements:1. If (3m3 + 2m2 + 5m + n) / m is not an integer, where m and n are integers, then n is not divisible by m.2. 5(8m) + 23m is divisible by 48 for all whole numbers m.Which of the statements given above is/are correct ?
The sum of two positive numbers is 40. If the GM of these two numbers is lower than their AM by 20%, then what is the difference between the two numbers ?
50 men can complete a work in 40 days. They begin the work together but a batch of 5 men left after each period of 10 days. What is the time to complete the work?
If x = ‌12‌+‌‌34‌+‌‌56‌+‌‌78‌+‌‌910, then which one of the following is correct?

A bottle contains spirit and water in the ratio 1 ∶ 4 and another identical bottle contains spirit and water in the ratio 4 ∶ 1. In what ratio should the mixtures in the two bottles be mixed to get a new mixture in which the ratio of spirit to water is 1 ∶ 3?
If 3 sin θ + 5 cos θ = 5, then what is the value of 5 sin θ - 3 cos θ ?

Consider the following in respect of the polynomial x4k + x4k+2 + x4k+4 + x4k+6.1. The remainder is zero when the polynomial is divided by x2 + 1.2. The remainder is zero when the polynomial is divided by x4 + 1.Which of the statements given above is / are correct ?
What is the minimum value of ‌ sin‌2⁡A‌+‌5 sin‌⁡A‌+‌1 sin‌⁡A for 0 < A ≤ ‌π‌2 ?
If ‌1a‌+‌‌1b‌+‌‌1c‌+‌‌1d‌+‌‌1e = ‌421972, then what is the value of a × b × c × d × e?
A cube whose edge is 14 cm long has on each of its faces a circle of 7 cm radius painted yellow. What is the total area of unpainted surface? (Takе π = ‌227)

From a circular metal plate of radius 7 cm and thickness 0.16 mm, a sector is cut off containing an angle 150°. The remaining piece is moulded into a spherical bead of radius r. What is the value of r in cm?

The chord AB of a circle with centre at O is 2√3 times the height of the minor segment. If P is the area of the sector OAB and Q is the area of the minor segment of the circle, then what is the approximate value of ‌PQ ?(Take √3 = 1.7 and π = 3.14)

What is the area of the region between two concentric circles, if the length of a chord of the outer circle touching the inner circle at a particular point of its circumference is 14 cm ? (Takе π = ‌227)
In a right - angled triangle ABC, AB = 15 cm, BC 20 cm and AC = 25 cm. Further, BP is the perpendicular on AC. What is the difference in the area of triangles PAB and PCB ?
Let the positive numbers a1, a2, a3, ...., a3n be in GP. If P is the GM of a1, a2, a3, ...., an and Q is the GM of an+1, an+2, an+3, ..., a3n, then what is the GM of 3n numbers?
The cost price of y articles is equal to selling price of z articles. If y ∶ z = 5 ∶ 4, what is the profit percentage?
A sum of money invested at simple interest triples itself in 8 years and becomes n times in 20 years. What is the value of n?
If the work done by x men in (x + 1) days is equal to the work done by (x + 5) men in (x - 2) days, then what is the value of x?
If (a + b) ∶ (b + c) ∶ (c + a) = 5 ∶ 7 ∶ 6, then what is the value of (a - b + c) ∶ (a + b - c)?

Let x be the compound interest at the end of 3 years on a sum of ₹ 1000 at the rate of 10% compounded annually and y be the simple interest at the end of 3 years on a sum of ₹ 1000 at the annual rate of 11%. What is the difference between x and y ?
In a quadrilateral ABCD, AB = 6 cm, BC = 18 cm, CD = 6 cm and DA = 10 cm. If the diagonal BD = x, then which one of the following is correct?
In a quarter circle of radius R, a circle of radius r is inscribed. What is the ratio of R to r ?
In a quadrilateral ABCD, AB = BC and CD = DA; AC and BD are diagonals such that AC = 6 cm and BD = 12 cm. What is the area of the quadrilateral?
If tan (3A) = cot (A - 22°), where 3A is an acute angle, then what is the value of A?
If ‌ sin‌⁡θ‌−cos‌⁡θ‌‌+‌1 sin‌⁡θ‌‌+‌cos‌⁡θ‌−1 = p sec θ + q tan θ, where 0 < θ < ‌π‌2, then what is p + q equal to?

The angles of elevation of the top of a tower from two points A and B at a distance of x m and (x + 5) m from the base of the tower of height 6 m and in the same straight line with it are complementary. What is the value of x?

Consider the following statements :1. In a triangle ABC, if sin A + sin B + sin C = ‌3√32, then the triangle can be equilateral.2. In a triangle ABC, if cos A + cos B + cos C = ‌32, then the triangle can be equilateral.Which of the statements given above is/are correct ?

Two trains A and B leave Delhi for Hyderabad at 7 : 00 a.m. and 7 : 50 a.m. on the same day and travel at 80 kmph and 100 kmph respectively. After how many kilometers from Delhi will the two trains be together?
The length, breadth and height of a cuboid are increased by 10%, 20% and 50% respectively. What is the percentage increase in volume of the cuboid?
₹ 9400 is distributed among P, Q, R in such a way that if ₹ 93, ₹ 24, ₹ 55 are deducted from their respective shares, then they have money in the ratio 3 ∶ 4 ∶ 5. What is the share of P?

If P2 varies as R and Q2 varies as R, (P ≠ Q), then which of the following are correct? 1. P2 + Q2 varies as R. 2. PQ varies as R. 3. P2 - Q2 varies as R. Select the correct answer using the code given below:
p number of men can finish a piece of work in q days. If there are 50% more men, then the work will be finished 12 days earlier. What is the value of q?
What is the minimum value of (‌a2‌+‌3a‌+‌1a) (‌b2‌+‌3b‌+‌1b) for a, b > 0?

Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Let a, b, c and d be positive integers.Question : Which one of a, b, c, d is closest to the product abcd?Statement - I : a > b > cStatement - II : c is not the smallest.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question cannot be answered even by using both Statements together.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Let mn = k, where m and n are prime numbers and k is an even number.Question : What is the value of mn - n + 1?Statement - I : m > nStatement - II : One of the numbers is 2.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by either Statement alone.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Question : If p is a positive integer, then what is the remainder when pn is divided by p + 1?Statement - I : n is even.Statement - II : p is even.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by using both the Statements together, but cannot be answered by using either Statement alone.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Question : Is xy positive?Statement - I : x = ‌3√−0.19683Statement - II : y = ‌3√x

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by either Statement alone.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Let a, b and c be the sides of a triangle ABC.Question : Is the triangle equilateral?Statement - I : a2 + b2 + c2 = (ab + bc + ca)Statement - II : 3a2 + 3b2 + 4c2 = 2ab + 4bc + 4ca

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by one of the Statements alone, but not by the other.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Area of a rectangle with length x and breadth y is P and area of a parallelogram (which is strictly not a rectangle) with adjacent sides of length x and y is Q.Question : Is P > Q?Statement - I : x ∶ y = 2 ∶ 1Statement - II: The angle between the two adjacent sides of the parallelogram is 60°.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by using both the Statements together, but cannot be answered by using either Statement alone.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Area of a rectangle with length x and breadth y is P and area of a parallelogram (which is strictly not a rectangle) with adjacent sides of length x and y is Q.A circle touches all the four sides AB, BC, CD, DA of a quadrilateral ABCD.Question : What is the perimeter of the quadrilateral ?Statement - I : AB + DC = 10 cmStatement - II : AD + BC = 10 cm

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question cannot be answered even by using both Statements together.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Area of a rectangle with length x and breadth y is P and area of a parallelogram (which is strictly not a rectangle) with adjacent sides of length x and y is Q.Question : What is the ratio of the lengths of diagonals of a rhombus ?Statement - I : One diagonal of the rhombus is equal to its side.Statement - II : The longer diagonal of the rhombus is equal to √3 times its side.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by using both the Statements together, but cannot be answered by using either Statement alone.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Area of a rectangle with length x and breadth y is P and area of a parallelogram (which is strictly not a rectangle) with adjacent sides of length x and y is Q.The chord of a circle of radius R touches at a point on the circumference of a concentric circle of radius r. The length of the chord is 24 units.Question : What are the values of r and R?Statement - I : r is an integer.Statement - II : R is an integer.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question cannot be answered even by using both Statements together.

content.question_text: Consider the following for the next ten (10) items that follow:Each item contains a Question followed by two Statements. Answer each item using the following instructions:Area of a rectangle with length x and breadth y is P and area of a parallelogram (which is strictly not a rectangle) with adjacent sides of length x and y is Q.P, Q, R, S are the mid - points of sides AB, BC, CD, DA respectively of a quadrilateral ABCD.Question : What is the difference in the area of the quadrilateral ABCD and the area of the quadrilateral PQRS ?Statement - I : Area of the quadrilateral ABCD is 100 square unit.Statement - II : Area of the quadrilateral PQRS is 50 square unit.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : If the Question can be answered by one of the Statements alone, but not by the other.

How far from station Q will the two trains meet?
At what time will the two trains meet?

What is the area of the square?
What is tan α + tan β equal to ?
What is the area of triangle CDE?
